definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electirc power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼还是电能的过度消费者与浪费者。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electric power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼也是电力的奢侈消费者和浪费者。

sentences.english: Slowly the wasters and despoilers are impoverishing our land.
sentences.chinese: 浪费者和掠夺者们在慢慢地糟蹋着我们的土地。

definition: lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to waste natural resources recklessly/not to know how to use things sparingly
see 謀財害命|谋财害命[mou2 cai2 hai4 ming4]
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
